title: Woman attacked in street by teenage gang after row in McDonald's
text:

A woman was punched and had her hair yanked by a gang of teenage girls after a row in McDonald's.

Police have released CCTV stills of three females and a male they are tracing who they believe could have vital information about the bust-up in Liverpool.

The victim, a 23-year-old woman, was involved in a verbal altercation inside the burger chain on July 23.

The dispute erupted into violence after the woman left the fast-food chain.

Shortly after the confrontation the woman was "assaulted by a small group of teenage girls” near the docks.

The attack left the woman with bruising and swelling to her face.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

Now detectives have released CCTV images of four people they believe could have vital information as part of the investigation.

A spokesman said: "Anyone who recognises the people pictured or has any information is asked to contact Merseyside Police."

Anyone with information can make contact on social media via Twitter @MerPolCC or Facebook Merseyside Police CC.

You can also call 101 quoting incident reference 19100401779 or contact the independent charity Crimestoppers anonymously, on 0800 555 111 or via their online form at: https://crimestoppers-uk.org/give-information/give-information.
description: Merseyside Police are searching for four people who could have vital information about the vicious attack
